citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A two-month-old Ibex was limping on its left front leg and not bearing weight on the leg when standing. According to
employees, it had broken this leg below the knee about 4 weeks earlier. They applied a splint to the leg, which had been
removed prior to the inspection. The Ibex was not examined by a veterinarian during this 4 week period. Inadequate
veterinary care of injuries can result in ongoing pain, incomplete healing, and possible permanent damage or
disfigurement. The licensee must have this animal examined by a veterinarian, must follow treatment recommendations,
and must maintain medical records.
TO BE CORRECTED BY MAY 17, 2023.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by July 16, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A two-month-old Ibex was limping on its left front leg and not bearing weight on the leg when standing.  According to 
employees, it had broken this leg below the knee about 4 weeks earlier.  They applied a splint to the leg, which had been 
removed prior to the inspection.  The Ibex was not examined by a veterinarian during this 4 week period.  Inadequate 
veterinary care of injuries can result in ongoing pain, incomplete healing, and possible permanent damage or 
disfigurement.  The licensee must have this animal examined by a veterinarian, must follow treatment recommendations, 
and must maintain medical records.  
TO BE CORRECTED BY MAY 17, 2023. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class  “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by July 16, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
 n
